revised_title: The Action of Resin and Allied Bodies on Photographic Plates in the Dark
tldr: The author investigates the action of resin and allied bodies on photographic plates in the dark, discovering that certain substances can affect the plates even at a distance and that the presence of oxygen is necessary for the reaction to occur. The study also reveals that the activity of resin can be transferred to non-active materials and that exposure to light can increase the activity of resin.
